en.title: The Secrets of Cat Purring: Why Do They Purr? Health Benefits and Meanings Explained
en.content:
A cat's purr is one of the most charming characteristics of cats. Let's explore the science behind how it works and what it means.

How Purring Works

Purring is produced by the larynx (throat muscles) vibrating 25 to 150 times per second. A distinctive feature is that the sound continues during both inhalation and exhalation, a mechanism unique to felines.

What Purring Means

Contentment and Relaxation

The most common reason. Cats purr when being petted, after meals, and when they are in a comfortable spot.

Requesting Something

The purr that means "I want food" has a subtly different frequency from a normal purr. Research has found it contains elements similar to a human baby's cry.

Self-Healing

Cats sometimes purr when injured or sick. Studies suggest that the vibrations promote bone repair and wound healing, and it is thought to be a natural self-healing mechanism.

Health Benefits for Humans

A cat's purr has been shown to lower the human stress hormone cortisol and reduce blood pressure. Research has also found that living with a cat can reduce the risk of heart attack by 40%.

zh.title: 猫咪咕噜声的秘密：为什么会发出咕噜声？健康功效与含义解读
zh.content:
猫咪的咕噜声（呼噜声）是猫最迷人的特征之一。让我们从科学角度来了解它的原理和含义。

咕噜声的原理

咕噜声是由喉部肌肉每秒振动25至150次产生的。其特点是吸气和呼气时都会持续发声，这种机制是猫科动物特有的。

咕噜声的含义

满足与放松

最常见的原因。猫咪在被抚摸时、饭后以及待在舒适的地方时会发出咕噜声。

表达需求

“我想吃饭”时的咕噜声与平时的微妙不同，频率有所差异。研究发现其中包含类似人类婴儿啼哭的元素。

自我治愈

猫咪在受伤或生病时也会发出咕噜声。研究表明这种振动能促进骨骼修复和伤口愈合，被认为是一种自然的自我治愈机制。

对人类的健康功效

猫咪的咕噜声被证实可以降低人体的压力激素（皮质醇）水平并降低血压。研究还发现，与猫咪一起生活可以将心脏病发作的风险降低40%。
